item.title: 阵亡将士纪念日公路旅行人数在后科维德热潮中创下新高
item.description: 据美国汽车协会（American Automobile Association）称，今年阵亡将士纪念日周末，美国将有约 3840 万人上路，是二十多年来追踪该节日出行数据最多的一次。【原文：About 38.4 million people will take to the roads this Memorial Day weekend in the US, the most in more than two decades of data tracking the holiday’s travel numbers, according to the American Automobile Association.】

item.title: 调查显示：德国经济痊愈，欧元区经济步伐加快
item.description: 彭博社（Bloomberg）对分析师进行的一项民意调查显示，随着欧元集团最大成员国摆脱一年多的近乎停滞状态，今年欧元区经济的扩张速度将超过此前的预期。【原文：The euro-are economy will expand more quickly than previously thought this year as the bloc’s biggest member exits more than a year of near-stagnation, a Bloomberg poll of analysts showed.】

item.title: Patron 募集 8.6 亿欧元用于欧洲不良房地产投资
item.description: Patron Capital 为其第七个欧洲房地产基金筹集了 8.6 亿欧元（9.27 亿美元）资金，该公司试图利用欧洲大陆房地产危机中出现的日益增多的不良资产浪潮。【原文：Patron Capital has raised €860 million ($927 million) for its seventh European property fund as the firm seeks to exploit a growing wave of distressed assets emerging from the continent’s real estate crisis.】

item.title: 欧盟对俄罗斯液化天然气的制裁对全球天然气意味着什么？
item.description: 自俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来，欧洲及其盟国一直在寻找既能遏制莫斯科的化石燃料收入，又不会使本国公民承担更高的能源成本的方法。最新的计划是：禁止使用欧盟港口转口液化天然气。【原文：Since the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Europe and its allies have looked for ways to curb Moscow’s fossil fuel revenues without inflicting higher energy costs on their own citizens. The latest plan: ban use of European Union ports for re-exporting liquefied natural gas.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财长表示将继续改革澳大利亚央行董事会
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）面对中右翼反对党提出的一些改革要求，决心继续推进对储备银行的改革，这预示着一场旷日持久的僵局即将到来。【原文：Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers is determined to press ahead with his overhaul of the Reserve Bank in the face of demands for some changes from the center-right opposition, foreshadowing a prolonged stalemate.】

item.title: 新西兰通胀预期进一步下降，新西兰元下跌
item.description: 新西兰通胀预期降至近三年来的最低水平，支持了投资者对新西兰央行今年晚些时候将开始降息的押注。新西兰元下跌。【原文：New Zealand inflation expectations fell to their lowest level in almost three years, supporting investor bets that the central bank will be able to start cutting interest rates later this year. The kiwi dollar dipped.】

item.title: 韩国计划 "有序软着陆 "房地产债务
item.description: 韩国当局周一公布了为房地产项目融资债务安排 "有序软着陆 "的措施，因为不断上升的拖欠率有可能拖累经济。【原文：South Korean authorities unveiled Monday measures to orchestrate an “orderly soft-landing” for real estate project-finance debt, with rising delinquency rates threatening to be a drag on the economy.】

item.title: 中国利用廉价天然气和煤炭重建库存
item.description: 中国正在利用国际煤炭和天然气价格下跌的机会，在又一个漫长而炎热的夏季到来之前补充电力燃料库存。【原文：China is taking advantage of lower international prices for coal and natural gas to replenish stockpiles of power fuels ahead of another long, hot summer.】

item.title: 中国在碧桂园付费后暂时避免了道德风险
item.description: 在碧桂园控股有限公司（Country Garden Holdings Co., Ltd.）支付债券利息后，中国为陷入困境的开发商提供债务支持的计划在数天内迎来了首次测试，但却避免了引发有关此类干预后果的争论。【原文：A Chinese program to backstop debt of distressed developers came within days of being tested for the first time, but averted fueling debate about the fallout from such intervention after Country Garden Holdings Co. paid bond interest.】

item.title: 日元面临压力，日本央行在定期操作中缩减债券购买规模
item.description: 与 4 月 24 日相比，日本央行在本周一的常规操作中提出购买更少量的政府债券，以减少其在该国债务市场中的存在。【原文：The Bank of Japan offered to purchase a smaller amount of government bonds in a regular operation on Monday than it did on April 24 as it seeks to reduce its presence in the country’s debt market.】

item.title: 亚洲对降息的反感正引导新兴市场债券投资者离场
item.description: 与全球同类债券相比，亚洲新兴债券的反弹空间可能较小，因为该地区的中央银行不太可能采取激进的降息措施。【原文：Emerging Asian bonds may have less room to rally compared to their global peers as central banks in the region are unlikely to embark on aggressive interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 中国白银贸易巨头欲进军新加坡市场
item.description: 中国民营冶炼企业河南金利金铅集团有限公司（Henan Jinli Gold and Lead Group Co.【原文：The commercial division of Chinese private smelter Henan Jinli Gold and Lead Group Co. is looking to expand its commodities trading team in Singapore, as the industry turns increasingly bullish on copper, aluminum and other metals.】

item.title: 英国国家环境基金（BNEF）称，日本将有可能在今年重启世界上最大的核电站
item.description: 据 BloombergNEF 报道，世界上最大的核电站在停运十多年后，很可能在今年恢复发电，这是有助于缓解日本电力成本的核电技术复兴的一部分。【原文：The world’s biggest nuclear plant is likely to resume generation this year after more than a decade offline, part of a revival of the technology that will help ease Japanese power costs, according to BloombergNEF.】

item.title: 中国将就出售 1,380 亿美元超长期债务举行会议
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，中国财政部将于周一召开会议，讨论今年出售 1 万亿元（1,380 亿美元）超长期特别中央政府债券的事宜。【原文：China’s Finance Ministry will hold a meeting on Monday to discuss the sale of 1 trillion yuan ($138 billion) of ultra-long special central government bonds this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 调查显示，Nvidia 可与黄金媲美作为抵御通胀的盾牌
item.description:
日元已失去其避风港货币地位

The yen has lost its haven currency status

】

item.title: 澳新银行集团称监管机构正在调查澳大利亚债券销售情况
item.description: 澳新银行集团控股有限公司（ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.）称，澳大利亚监管机构正在调查该公司去年执行政府债券销售的情况。【原文：ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. said Australian regulators are investigating the firm’s execution of a government bond sale last year.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 拜登将宣布对中国征收关税。普京宣布令人震惊的改组。最新数据显示中国需求疲软。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：Biden to announce China tariffs. Putin announces shock reshuffle. Fresh data signals weak China demand. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 石油走低，伊拉克的混合信号使欧佩克+成为焦点
item.description: 石油走低，原因是交易商期待欧佩克+就供应政策召开会议，而伊拉克对其立场发出的信息不一。【原文：Oil edged lower as traders looked ahead to an OPEC+ meeting on supply policy, with Iraq giving out mixed messages about its stance.】

item.title: 中国数据公布后，亚洲股市开局低迷：市场综述
item.description: 由于有迹象表明美国经济放缓以及周末数据显示中国需求疲软，亚洲股市周一开盘将表现低迷。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a sluggish open Monday amid signs of a slowing US economy and weekend data that signaled weak demand in China.】

item.title: 贝莱德警告日元疲软使外国人远离日本股票
item.description: 日元的疲软正在使外国投资者远离日本股票。【原文：The yen’s weakness is turning foreign investors away from Japanese stocks.】

item.title: 印度卢比看涨理由受印度央行干预担忧影响
item.description: 随着外资流入的加快，印度卢比有望反弹。但分析师警告说，央行可能会限制涨幅。【原文：Hopes are running high that India’s rupee will stage a rebound as foreign inflows quicken. But analysts warn the central bank is likely to limit the gains.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）与总部位于新加坡的奥兰农业控股有限公司（Olam Agri Holdings Ltd.）为争夺澳大利亚的收购权，正在棉花行业展开一场激烈的争夺战。全球气温不断刷新纪录，对农业、能源和生命本身造成了广泛影响。钯金的光芒正在被铂金所掩盖。【原文：The cotton industry is witnessing a fierce battle that pits Louis Dreyfus Co. against Singapore-based Olam Agri Holdings Ltd. in the pursuit of an Australian takeover. Global temperatures keep breaking records — causing wide-ranging impacts for agriculture and energy, and life itself. And palladium is losing its shine to platinum.】

item.title: 舒默敦促美国联邦贸易委员会为雪佛龙-赫斯交易 "踩刹车
item.description: 参议院多数党领袖查克-舒默（Chuck Schumer）周日敦促联邦贸易委员会暂停雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer on Sunday urged the Federal Trade Commission to pause Chevron Corp.’s proposed $53 billion takeover of Hess Corp., arguing the deal would give the oil industry more power to raise gas prices.】

item.title: 加拿大特鲁多放弃对公寓业主征税的威胁
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）领导的政府在遭到加拿大房地产投资信托行业的反对后，收回了用新税制打击部分房地产投资信托的威胁。【原文：The government of Justin Trudeau pulled back on a threat to hit some real estate investment trusts in Canada with a new tax regime after opposition from the industry.】

item.title: 债券交易员等待消费物价指数助推市场反弹或使市场陷入绝境
item.description: 今年以来，决定美国债券市场走向的莫过于每月的通胀数据。本周也不例外。【原文：Nothing has been setting the US bond market’s direction this year more than the monthly inflation figures. This week will be no exception.】

item.title: 世界顶级咖啡、大豆和糖供应商也想统治可可行业
item.description:
巴西曾经欣欣向荣的农作物因疾病而几乎绝收，30多年后，大西洋彼岸的短缺为农民提供了立足之地。【原文：

More than 30 years after Brazil’s once-thriving crop was nearly decimated by disease, a shortfall on the other side of the Atlantic gives farmers a foothold.

】

item.title: 末日衰退心态让 S&P 500 指数保持强劲势头
item.description: 由于担心经济衰退，北美最大的公司都在努力降低成本，因此它们的季度盈利有望达到至少两年来的最佳水平。【原文：North America’s largest companies are on track to post their best quarterly earnings relative to expectations in at least two years, as they’ve worked to keep costs down over fears of a recession.】

item.title: 派息是大科技公司财务实力的最新标志
item.description: 在不惜一切代价追逐增长多年之后，科技公司开始从老派价值型企业的游戏规则中汲取教训：支付股息。公司抛出的现金多到花不完，转而定期派息为公司的财务实力提供了更多证据。【原文：After years of chasing growth at all costs, tech firms are taking a page from the playbook of old-school value businesses — paying a dividend. Throwing off more cash than they can spend, the shift to a regular payout provides more evidence for the companies’ financial strength.】

item.title: 财政部称澳大利亚通胀率可能在 2024 年达到澳大利亚央行的目标
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部在即将公布的预算中预测，通胀率可能会在 2024 年底前回到央行的目标范围内，这比政府或央行之前的预测都要早。【原文：Australia’s Treasury is forecasting that inflation could return to the central bank’s target band before the end of 2024 — earlier than either the government or the bank previously predicted — as part of its upcoming budget.】

item.title: 受美联储影响，投资者看好新兴市场
item.description: 资金经理们对 2024 年初流行的新兴市场押注耿耿于怀，即使今年已经过去了五个月，这笔交易仍已解体。【原文：Money managers are digging their heels in over a popular emerging-market bet in early 2024 even as the trade has unraveled five months into the year.】
